page.title: 02LONGFORGAN AND ENVIRONS "II"
page.content: The livelihood of the people in the surrounding area is closely related to agriculture. In many cases local farms are handed down from generation to generation and despite the problems of inclement weather and traditional farming problems most farmers would not wish to change their way of life. Although not on public service routes in many cases people living outwith the village nearly always have their own transport for necessary visits to the city. Mobile shopping vans serve outlying areas on a regular basis. Any disadvantages are outweighed by the benefits of having a rural and contented way of life with the true values of the country dwellers. In recent years the village population has been increased with a number of families moving into new Council houses ,and coming mainly from Dundee.
